body.name: Under Desk Cable Management Tray Black, No Drill Desk Cable Management Organizer with Clamp for Desk Wire Management, Desk PC Cord Organizer Accessories & Workspace Organizers for Office, Home(1 Pack)

Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 9 hrs 47 mins
features: 【𝑬𝒂𝒔𝒚 𝑰𝒏𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 & 𝑵𝒐 𝒅𝒓𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒊𝒏𝒈】No drilling required. Kaiferty under desk cable management tray can be easily hung on your desk, allowing you to change its position to suit your needs. The clamp of this cord management tray features an EVA scratch-resistant pad to protect your desk from any marks or damage.

【𝑻𝒉𝒆 𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒄𝒊𝒂𝒍 𝒄𝒊𝒓𝒄𝒖𝒍𝒂𝒓 𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒊𝒈𝒏】The special circular cutout on the side of the under desk cable management allows you to directly place cables into the basket for easy organization and collection without the need for repeated disassembly.
【𝑫𝒊𝒔𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒗𝒆 𝒕𝒓𝒂𝒑𝒆𝒛𝒐𝒊𝒅𝒂𝒍 𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒊𝒈𝒏】The distinctive trapezoidal design on the side not only facilitates cable observation and adjustment, but also enhances its aesthetic appeal.
【𝑺𝒍𝒆𝒆𝒌 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝑰𝒏𝒗𝒊𝒔𝒊𝒃𝒍𝒆 𝑫𝒆𝒔𝒊𝒈𝒏】Kaiferty cable management box under desk features a unique and minimalist design that keeps cable bundles out of sight.

【𝑻𝒉𝒆 𝒎𝒆𝒔𝒉 𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒊𝒈𝒏】The mesh design is used to flexibly route cables with the included zip ties and effectively reduces dust buildup. Additionally, desk cord organizer will remain highly breathable to prevent overheating of power sources.
【𝑼𝒑𝒈𝒓𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒅 𝑴𝒆𝒕𝒂𝒍 𝑴𝒆𝒔𝒉 𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒖𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏】Made entirely of powder-coated Kaiferty carbon steel, wire management under desk structure is sturdy, durable, rust-resistant, and deformation-resistant.

【𝑴𝒂𝒙𝒊𝒎𝒊𝒛𝒆 𝑺𝒕𝒐𝒓𝒂𝒈𝒆 𝑺𝒑𝒂𝒄𝒆】The Kaiferty under desk cable management tray system provides comprehensive cable organization, eliminating hanging or tangled wires. Organize all your data cables, power cords, and power strips off the floor. Hide your cables under your feet to maintain a clean and tidy workspace and floor.

【𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒀𝒐𝒖 𝑮𝒆𝒕】The desk cable management under desk kit includes 1 cable tray, 2 cable clips, and 5 zip ties. This cord organizer is not only suitable for your office desk but also for use in the kitchen and outdoors. Keep your office and home neat and beautified.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and good capacity
reviews.reviewText: Solid mount and build. Carries all of my cables and was a super quick, easy, and cheap way to clean up underneath my desk. Currently holding cables for 2 monitors, 3 peripherals, and some other charger/light cables.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great way to manage and hide cables
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for cable management and a way to keep cables off the floor and hanging behind my desk. I had to "customize" it slightly for it to work on the frame of a Tresanti desk (sold through Costco) by removing what I call anti-rattle foam pads and foot-pads off if the mounting screw.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Handy little thing!
reviews.reviewText: The product is sturdy, easily adjusted to fit nearly any desk/table. It is a good size as well, so it fits plenty of plugs and cords.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A thoughtful design fo cable management
reviews.reviewText: I've recently reviewed a number of under-desk cable management trays. All seem to have their individual pros and cons. Some you can adjust the width on. Some have a base that amounts to a big piece of bent wires that pretty much lets cables come in and out at any angle, making it really easy to access and mess with behind a desk but which looks like a rats nest if left visible.All of them seem to come with a bunch of extras in the form of ties and sticky cable holder things and all have pretty good ventilation which, combined with keeping a power strip or other hardware off the floor, helps keep everything cool.This particular unit falls into a mesh subset of these designs. The potential disadvantage I see with this design - and this one is no exception - is that the mesh isn't all that thick and feels like, with constant use, will get bent up and distorted over time. It's probably not going to outright break but if you're messing with stuff in it on any regular basis, it's probably not going to stay pretty.With this style, they like to also show off how it can be used as under-desk storage for things other than cables but with this particular design, if you're looking to use it for cable management, there are a couple of nice features I'd like to point out.First, the top edge is angled. It starts out tall on the back and gets lower towards the front. This makes accessing whatever you put in it a lot easier without sacrificing much. The other thing I like about it, is that the "portholes" on the ends, intended to be where the cables go in and out, have a narrow opening at the top.That second thing may not seem like all that big of a deal and if you plan to set this up once and forget about it, it's not but if you live in the real world, over time, you're going to be needing to get to this thing to add and remove stuff and in that scenario, not having to snake power plugs with their chunky ends closest and potentially thinner device plugs on the other end being at the other end of 3-6' of cable, this is a really nice feature that'll allow you to take something in and out of this setup without having to devote 30 minutes to getting everything connected back up when you're done.The mesh style seem to do a better job of organizing cable setups in a way that looks neat and less cluttered in general but the same things that make them look nicer also, to some degree work against them in terms of flexibility. This design, is a pretty well thought out way to address that shortcoming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Straight forward instructions. Perfect size. Durable. It fastens securely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have this to hold my power strip for my gaming setup to keep it off the ground and liable to get pulled somewhere. It helps with the cord organization as well. Very pleased with this product, I dont want to test the surge protection part but until i do i cant completely judge this. if I have any issues though i will come back and update my review

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars great functionality if hidden under desk but not if cosmetic
reviews.reviewText: I got a dual set and used them as a sub-shelf under a floating shelf. So they're in plain site. When side-by-side it is obvious that the dimensions between the 2 are about a 1/4 in off in length and width... Not a consistent/precision measured piece by any means but probably eye-balled during manufacturing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed!
reviews.reviewText: I needed a cable management system that would move up and down with my standing desk and this is the perfect solution. Before I got this, I considered mounting my surge protector under the desk, but then I would have to do more work to hide all the cords that went to it. Now I can just wrap up my cords and store them in the tray. This tray also came with a couple of cable management ties and stickies. I used the ties to secure the cord from my surge protector to my desk leg, so now everything is nice and tucked away.This tray fits my 12-inch surge protector perfectly, and there was enough room left over to store the battery block from my monitor in there too. But I don't think it could fit much more in there, so this might not work for someone who has a lot of stuff to plug in (or you will have to use extra cable management to hide your cords).Overall I'm very pleased with this! It's a simple way to get the cords off my desk and floor. The perfect low-tech solution for me.
